summary: Email chain between Sigrid McCawley, a partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, and Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York, coordinating meetings and video conferences for interviews with witnesses (including one in Spain) in early September 2019. The scheduling involves a Preska hearing and travel constraints.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, attorney
persons.context: Attorney coordinating meetings and video conferences for witness interviews with the U.S. Attorney's Office, discussing scheduling conflicts and travel arrangements.

connections.description: Both appear to be part of a legal team coordinating meetings with the U.S. Attorney's Office, with M forwarding calendar invites and updates.

events.title: Scheduled meeting with witness
events.description: Meeting scheduled for 1:00 p.m. with a witness, coordinated between Sigrid McCawley and the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Preska hearing
events.description: Hearing before Judge Preska regarding document release issues in the v. Maxwell case, scheduled for 11:00 a.m.

events.title: Proposed meeting date
events.description: Alternative date proposed for a meeting with a witness, but conflicts arose.

keyFacts: Sigrid McCawley, a partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, is coordinating witness interviews with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in September 2019.
A witness is in Spain (Barcelona), and a video conference interview is proposed as an alternative to an in-person meeting.
A hearing before Judge Preska regarding document release issues in the v. Maxwell case is scheduled for September 11, 2019, affecting attorney availability.
Scheduling conflicts include a hurricane threat in Florida impacting travel plans.
The emails involve discussions about attorney availability for accompanying witnesses during interviews with prosecutors.
